title: Mobile left sidebar hamburger drawer + Reddit-style right sidebar panel styling

requirements.text: Add a mobile-only hamburger menu button to the left of the Ribbit logo in the header that toggles the LeftSidebar as an off-canvas drawer (Reddit-style).

quotes: Can you add the left sidebar on mobile? Add a hamburger menu to the left of the logo in the  header that activates it just like Reddit.

acceptanceCriteria: On viewport widths below the desktop breakpoint (below `lg`), a hamburger icon button is visible to the immediate left of the logo in the header.
On `lg` and above, the hamburger icon is hidden and the existing desktop left sidebar remains unchanged.

requirements.text: Implement the mobile left sidebar as an off-canvas drawer that slides in from the left with a scrim overlay, containing the existing LeftSidebar content without duplicating logic.

quotes: Add the left sidebar on mobile... just like Reddit.

acceptanceCriteria: Tapping the hamburger opens a left-side drawer showing the same navigation links and Recent Activity list as the current `LeftSidebar` component.
A semi-transparent scrim covers the rest of the page while the drawer is open.
Tapping the scrim closes the drawer.
The drawer is scrollable if its content exceeds the viewport height.
The drawer closes automatically on route navigation (e.g., tapping a link inside the sidebar).
Desktop layout in `HomePage` (left sidebar / feed / right sidebar grid) remains unchanged.

requirements.text: Restyle the RightSidebar to match the requested Reddit-like right column container: a soft light-gray panel background on the whole column and a rounded border radius on the container.

quotes: the right column on reddit has a gray background and a border radius

acceptanceCriteria: On desktop (`lg` and above), the entire `RightSidebar` column renders as a single rounded container with a light gray/tinted background (not pure white).
The RightSidebar inner sections (Trending Ponds / Popular Tags / Hot This Week) remain stacked as they are now; only the outer container styling is updated to match the requested look.
Right sidebar remains hidden on mobile, consistent with the current layout.

constraints: Do not edit any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (compose existing UI components instead).
Do not edit any paths listed in `frontend.immutablePaths` in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Do not add new right-sidebar content modules or change its data sources (only adjust styling to match the gray rounded panel request).
Do not implement new authentication or account features.
Do not change desktop grid sizing or column widths beyond what is required to apply the right sidebar container styling.
